Effect: May paralyze opponent.
Mechanics: Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes DICE_DAMAGE MOVE_TYPE damage.

Effect: Paralyzes opponent.
Mechanics: Choose a Pokémon that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the Paralyzed condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Effect: May paralyze opponent.
Mechanics: A storm cloud appears at a point within range that you can see above yourself. It takes the shape of a Cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 60-foot radius. When you cast the spell, choose a point you can see under the cloud. A lightning bolt shoots from the cloud to that point. Each creature within 5 feet of that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking DICE_DAMAGE MOVE_TYPE damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Until the spell ends, you can take a Magic action to call down lightning in that way again, targeting the same point or a different one.
Summary: The user attacks the target with a strong electric blast.

Effect: Lowers opponent's Defense.

Effect: Reverses stat changes of opponent.

Effect: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

Effect: Weakens the power of Fire-type moves.
Mechanics: You choose an area of water that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways: (1) You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the water as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction. This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage. (2) You cause the water to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction. This change lasts for 1 hour. (3) You change the water’s color or opacity. The water must be changed in the same way throughout. This change lasts for 1 hour. (4) You freeze the water, provided that there are no creatures in it. The water unfreezes in 1 hour. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.
Summary: The user controls water.

Effect: The higher the user's HP, the higher the damage caused.
Summary: The user spouts water to damage opposing Pokémon. The lower the user's HP, the lower the move's power.

Effect: In battles, the opponent switches. In the wild, the Pokémon runs.
Mechanics: A Line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the duration. Each creature in the Line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the Line. A creature that ends its turn in the Line must make the same save. Any creature in the Line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you. The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them. As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can change the direction in which the Line blasts from you.
Summary: The user whips up a whirlwind to blow things away.

Effect: Burns opponent.
Mechanics: While there, the wisps emit warmth but ignite nothing. Each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius. As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A wisp must be within 20 feet of another wisp created by this spell, and a wisp vanishes if it exceeds the spell’s range. Until the spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action to hurl a wisp at a creature or an object within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes DICE_DAMAGE MOVE_TYPE damage.
Summary: You create up to four hovering wisps of mysterious flame within range.
The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.

Effect: Puts opponent to sleep in the next turn.
Mechanics: Each creature of your choice in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the Unconscious condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell’s effect. Pokemon with the Insomnia ability or that have Immunity to the Exhaustion condition automatically succeed on saves against this spell.
Summary: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep.
